sanskrit_verse:
विक्रयाद्यो धनं किं चिद्गृह्णीयात्कुलसंनिधौ ।
क्रयेण स विशुद्धं हि न्यायतो लभते धनम् ॥ ८.२०१॥
transliteration: vikrayād yo dhanaṁ kiṁ cid gṛhṇīyāt kulasaṁnidhau | krayeṇa sa viśuddhaṁ hi nyāyato labhate dhanam || 8.201 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who acquires wealth through sale or transaction in the presence of the family lineage shall obtain that wealth lawfully when acquired through righteous purchase.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from transparent action within ancestral and societal visibility
Causation aligns with conscious exchange and witnessed economic activity
Capacity-based responsibility arises through active participation in a recognized socio-economic framework
Restoration logic emphasizes lawful acquisition leading to rightful ownership
Consciousness alignment occurs when transactions are conducted openly and in accordance with dharma
executable_legal_axioms: IF wealth is acquired via sale AND transaction occurs under familial or lineage witness THEN ownership is valid AND enforceable
IF purchase is made transparently within visible social structures THEN legal title transfers without contest
IF economic exchange lacks concealment AND aligns with community norms THEN it constitutes lawful possession
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating property disputes, the court must affirm transactions executed openly within recognized lineage or societal oversight. Covert dealings are inherently invalid due to lack of alignment with dharma-based transparency.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is established through visible exchange; anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as lawful consequence of open conduct; proportional responsibility lies in maintaining integrity of transactional space; punitive response is absent because misaligned actions naturally fail to establish legitimate claim.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion process ensures all parties acknowledge the validity of witnessed exchange
Responsibility assumption protocol confirms mutual understanding and consent at time of transaction
Capacity restoration involves reaffirming lineage or societal witnessing where previously absent
Integrity reintegration occurs through public acknowledgment of lawful ownership transfer
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. Dharma is restored through conscious, witnessed exchange. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness stands as the ultimate adjudicator.
